legacy.full_text: Happy Chinese Lunar New Year! What does the Spring Festival Gala (Chunwan) mean to Chinese people? How have changes in China changed the show over the decades? @JoeWongComedy, musician and artist Cheng Lin, and Z Xavier, a pianist, joined @thepointwithlx for a lively discussion

legacy.description: Official account of the commentary program on China Global TV Network - "The Point with LIU Xin". Find us on https://t.co/BSTjikSPNB.
legacy.name: CGTN The Point with LIU Xin

legacy.full_text: Chinese students are often affected by racial biases : there is an "unconscious bias". He cited a study that shows when prospective graduate students reach out for guidance, those with  “ethnic-sounding” name are less likely to receive a response @thepointwithlx https://t.co/LBM2MjugIf

legacy.description: Official account of the commentary program on China Global TV Network - "The Point with LIU Xin". Find us on https://t.co/BSTjikSPNB.

legacy.full_text: Is speaking a foreign language 100% of the time realistic? Professor Li Jinzhao shared her experience of trying to speak English all the time. But it's very hard. She would automatically switch to Chinese when speaking with Chinese friends.  @thepointwithlx https://t.co/7DOUMjHdEb

legacy.description: Official account of the commentary program on China Global TV Network - "The Point with LIU Xin". Find us on https://t.co/BSTjikSPNB.

legacy.full_text:
Western media presents different versions of news to target readers 
Prof. He Wenping: stories about China forgiving debt doesn't make it to English/ French-language versions.  Instead they reach Chinese readers who may get upset at the Chinese government. @thepointwithlx https://t.co/Oy1UjLxEOf

legacy.description: Official account of the commentary program on China Global TV Network - "The Point with LIU Xin". Find us on https://t.co/BSTjikSPNB.
legacy.name: CGTN The Point with LIU Xin

legacy.full_text: Fake news or honest mistake? WSJ cites off-mark figure in China-Cameroon debt. Prof. He Wenping: WSJ journalist could have made an honest mistake in the currency conversion, but regardless, could have led to people's misdjugement on China's debts with Africa  @thepointwithlx https://t.co/ToyqyslLII

legacy.description: Official account of the commentary program on China Global TV Network - "The Point with LIU Xin". Find us on https://t.co/BSTjikSPNB.
legacy.name: CGTN The Point with LIU Xin

legacy.full_text: Can you speak a foreign language 100% of the time? @DavidSLaw: It's within the university's responsibility to say there are different settings where you need to be using a common language. But it's difficult to see the educational justification in social settings @thepointwithlx https://t.co/CUkm1PGzTV

legacy.description: Official account of the commentary program on China Global TV Network - "The Point with LIU Xin". Find us on https://t.co/BSTjikSPNB.
legacy.name: CGTN The Point with LIU Xin

legacy.full_text: A Duke University professor emailed students, asking them to “commit to using English 100% of the time” while in department buildings. Prof. Li Jinzhao: "She wasn't sensitive enough to intercultural conflict and shouldn't single out the Chinese language. "@thepointwithlx https://t.co/8Syr9L075K

legacy.description: Official account of the commentary program on China Global TV Network - "The Point with LIU Xin". Find us on https://t.co/BSTjikSPNB.
legacy.name: CGTN The Point with LIU Xin

legacy.full_text: Duke incident probably wouldn’t happen to French/German-speaking white students @DavidSLaw shared his personal experience like being told not to speak English in public. Many Asians growing up in North America are victims of stereotypes based on their language. @thepointwithlx https://t.co/OAiE0PSeYw

value.string_value: Universities abroad have come under attack for financially benefiting from admitting Chinese students, while allegedly failing to provide adequate support for them or struggling to prevent racist...
Analysis | A Duke professor’s 'hurtful’ warning to Chinese students is part of a more global problem

legacy.name: summary_large_image

legacy.description: Democracy Dies in Darkness
legacy.name: The Washington Post

legacy.full_text: A Duke professor’s "hurtful" warning to Chinese students is part of a more global problem https://t.co/doKuAC5yz5

Foreign student advisors told us to “be slow to take offense” I didn’t understand what was meant by that, until I met a professor who said to a group of Chinese students,”The Chinese characters take so long to learn no wonder China is so backwards.”

legacy.full_text: What will happen to Chinese swimmer Sun Yang's career? Prof. John Gong believes that Sun Yang has a clean record. He thinks the 2014 incident, in which he was banned for three months for taking a stimulant, is a benign accident.@thepointwithlx https://t.co/KHteiaobmn

legacy.description: Official account of the commentary program on China Global TV Network - "The Point with LIU Xin". Find us on https://t.co/BSTjikSPNB.
legacy.name: CGTN The Point with LIU Xin

legacy.full_text:
The claim that Sun Yang might be banned for life "just doesn’t hold water"
Prof. John Gong: Sun had a good reason to reject drug tests that didn’t follow procedure. The Sunday Times article failed to highlight that FINA sided with Sun Yang @thepointwithlx https://t.co/0sVLdl66Nl

legacy.full_text:
BT gets new licenses in China: Market access to go far beyond telecoms
BT has become the first foreign telecom firm to provide direct services in China. Xu Sitao @DeloitteChina thinks this is providing competition in sectors previously dominated by strong players @thepointwithlx https://t.co/zIUxy2QX5Z

legacy.full_text:
Did US pull out of the INF Treaty because of China?
Zhao Tong: @zhaot2005 The US hopes to untie its hands and have its options of developing missiles to counter the "China threat.” However, China develops missiles only to protect its perceived national interests.@thepointwithlx https://t.co/0nTQb0k4im

legacy.description: Official account of the commentary program on China Global TV Network - "The Point with LIU Xin". Find us on https://t.co/BSTjikSPNB.
legacy.name: CGTN The Point with LIU Xin

legacy.full_text:
The "reciprocity" in US charges against Chinese subway spying
Prof. John Gong: many Chinese people, including top officials, travel in US-made Boeing airplanes. It's fairly easy for Boeing to spy on them. Where is the "reciprocity" in such espionage charges?@thepointwithlx #China https://t.co/iUwGr7r2XN

legacy.description: Official account of the commentary program on China Global TV Network - "The Point with LIU Xin". Find us on https://t.co/BSTjikSPNB.
legacy.name: CGTN The Point with LIU Xin

legacy.full_text:
"Ludicrous" accusations over Chinese-made subway cars 
Prof. John Gong: This type of concern would be understandable toward "Nazi Germany" when you're in a war with them, he said. But you shouldn't treat a trading partner with such suspicion. @thepointwithlx #China #espionage https://t.co/eoi5d85npb

legacy.full_text: What’s China's proposal for solving Venezuela's crisis? China is a big stakeholder in Venezuela. "China will not lecture the Latin American people & is not at all eager to impose its preference on the Venezuelan people. "Unlike the US, China will not interfere.  @thepointwithlx https://t.co/eCV9KvBs04

legacy.full_text: What's the real story in Xinjiang camps? Emily Liu has been running Xinjiang stories.  "People in the training centers are learning national regulations & laws. They live in dormitories, and do sports in playgrounds. But the Western media never believe it." @thepointwithlx https://t.co/P9AP8hZeHf

legacy.full_text: What would the US think if Venezuela claimed that Hilary Clinton was the legitimate leader since Donald Trump is under investigation for Russia interfering in the 2016 election?  US-Venezuela row escalates as the US “pours fuel on the fire”. @thepointwithlx #Venezuela #US #Maduro https://t.co/6mGqQnBgFz

legacy.full_text: "At worst, the US could fine Huawei but not detain its executives." HSBC was fined $1.92 billion by US authorities for laundering a river of drug money flowing out of Mexico and other banking lapses. Why not fine Huawei, but instead detain its exec? @thepointwithlx https://t.co/1NksnUyKsY
